values.description: During `ignition::gui::stop()` the method `g_app->quit()` is called followed by setting `g_app` to `nullptr`. A few lines later `quit()` is called again. This removes the second call to `quit()`.
values.title: Remove use of g_app after freeing memory

summary.raw: During `ignition::gui::stop()` the method `g_app->quit()` is called followed by setting `g_app` to `nullptr`. A few lines later `quit()` is called again. This removes the second call to `quit()`.
summary.html: During ignition::gui::stop() the method g_app->quit() is called followed by setting g_app to nullptr. A few lines later quit() is called again. This removes the second call to quit().

values.description: This fixes a crash during `ignition::gui::stop()` caused by a double free on plugins. Qt [steals ownership](http://doc.qt.io/qt-5/objecttrees.html) of all `QWidget` given to it, and deletes them when the window containing the widgets is closed. When `stop()` calls `g_plugins.clear()` it causes the destructor to be called on objects that have already been deleted by Qt. This fixes it by releasing ownership from the smart pointers after giving them to Qt.
values.title: Remove double-free on plugins after giving ownership to Qt

summary.raw: This fixes a crash during `ignition::gui::stop()` caused by a double free on plugins. Qt [steals ownership](http://doc.qt.io/qt-5/objecttrees.html) of all `QWidget` given to it, and deletes them when the window containing the widgets is closed. When `stop()` calls `g_plugins.clear()` it causes the destructor to be called on objects that have already been deleted by Qt. This fixes it by releasing ownership from the smart pointers after giving them to Qt.
summary.html: This fixes a crash during ignition::gui::stop() caused by a double free on plugins. Qt steals ownership of all QWidget given to it, and deletes them when the window containing the widgets is closed. When stop() calls g_plugins.clear() it causes the destructor to be called on objects that have already been deleted by Qt. This fixes it by releasing ownership from the smart pointers after giving them to Qt.

values.description:
Requires the following ignition-common PRs:

* #!/ignitionrobotics/ign-common/pull-requests/45
* #!/ignitionrobotics/ign-common/pull-requests/50


## Examples

### Command line

~~~
$ ign gui -l
/home/louise/plugins/
└── No plugins
/home/louise/.ignition/gui/plugins
├── libhello_plugin.so
└── libhello_plugin2.so
/usr/local/lib/ign-gui-0/plugins
└── libImageDisplay.so
~~~

### Window

![insertplugin.gif](data/bitbucket.org/repo/64K5zaR/images/614961159-insertplugin.gif)

values.description:
## Hide title bar

It's possible to hide a plugin's toolbar from the configuration file setting `<has_titlebar>` to false, for example `examples/config/hellodouble.config`:

~~~
<?xml version="1.0"?>

<plugin filename="libhello_plugin.so">
</plugin>

<plugin filename="libhello_plugin.so">
  <has_titlebar>false</has_titlebar>
</plugin>
~~~

![hastitle.png](data/bitbucket.org/repo/64K5zaR/images/3234061717-hastitle.png)

## Default context menu

All plugins come with a default context menu with a close option.

![contextpub.png](data/bitbucket.org/repo/64K5zaR/images/2256910751-contextpub.png)

## Custom context menu

Plugins can override the default menu, like the `custom_context_menu` example plugin shows:

![customexample.png](data/bitbucket.org/repo/64K5zaR/images/524187648-customexample.png)
values.title: Configuration to hide toolbar, default context menu, example with custom context menu

values.description:
* Running `ign gui` without any arguments opens an empty window

* Load / save config files from File menu

* Config files now can also store window position, size and state. See more on the README

* Improved docking behaviour by using only one dock region

![layout.gif](data/bitbucket.org/repo/64K5zaR/images/1391774631-layout.gif)

* Config files now can also store window position, size and state. See more on the README

* Improved docking behaviour by using only one dock region

summary.html:
• Running ign gui without any arguments opens an empty window

  • Load / save config files from File menu

  • Config files now can also store window position, size and state. See more on the README

  • Improved docking behaviour by using only one dock region

values.description:
Plugin that dynamically shows the list of Ignition Topics. All topics that are part of Ignition Messages are introspectable and can be expanded and collapsed.

It also has a search widget for filtering topics or fields by name.

Thanks to @iche033 and @chapulina for the suggestions on porting most of the code from Gazebo.

![topic_viewer.png](data/bitbucket.org/repo/64K5zaR/images/4211734814-topic_viewer.png)
values.title: Topic viewer

values.description:
Beginnings of material design styling for the table introduced on pull request #18.

![locho.gif](data/bitbucket.org/repo/64K5zaR/images/2182725068-locho.gif)

* [Data tables material design spec](https://material.io/guidelines/components/data-tables.html)
* TODO:
    * Highlight on hover
    * Change selection color (or remove selection once hover is working)
    * Left-align headers
* Search updates quicker (need to find out why `filterChanged` is not working)
* A lot of the implementation was done with delegates, which would need to be repeated for every table. Unfortunately, QSS is just not powerful enough for all styling. We might want to make the delegates more generic and reusable.
* Cleaned up some bits left over from plotting
* I'm working on another PR to make the search logic reusable
values.title: Table material design style

  • Cleaned up some bits left over from plotting
  • I'm working on another PR to make the search logic reusable

values.description:
Pull request #17 added an example on how to override the default style using cmake. This PR adds many other ways to do it:

From the command line:

    ign gui -s libPublisher.so -t examples/standalone/style_cmake/style.qss

On a config file:

    ign gui -c examples/config/stylesheet.config

With C++:

    ignition::gui::setQssFile(const std::string &_qssFile)
    ignition::gui::applyStyleSheet()

Through the GUI:

![qss.gif](data/bitbucket.org/repo/64K5zaR/images/4084367144-qss.gif)

## Future work

* Allow separate stylesheets for each plugin
* Offer preset material design styles. For this I'm currently pursuing 2 leads:
    1. Generating stylesheets substituting color variables on a template stylesheet
    1. Supporting QtQuick and its built-in material design styles
values.title: Custom stylesheets

values.description:
Only classes containing the `Q_OBJECT` macro should be added to `qt_headers`, otherwise this warning comes up on compile time:

`Note: No relevant classes found. No output generated.`
values.title: Fix 'No relevant classes found.' warning

summary.raw:
Only classes containing the `Q_OBJECT` macro should be added to `qt_headers`, otherwise this warning comes up on compile time:

`Note: No relevant classes found. No output generated.`
summary.html:
Only classes containing the Q_OBJECT macro should be added to qt_headers, otherwise this warning comes up on compile time:

Note: No relevant classes found. No output generated.

values.description:
[Port](https://bitbucket.org/osrf/gazebo/src/58fbe39d9e90bcfabc9f4a2ba911ce934b29b66a/gazebo/gui/Conversions.hh?fileviewer=file-view-default) of `gazebo::gui::Conversions` with a few changes:

* Functions are in the global `ignition::gui` namespace instead of being static members of a class
* Use `ignition::math::Color` instead of `common::Color`

values.description: This pull request introduces the ability to set a default configuration file. The default configuration file will be saved when the user press "Save configuration". In the user wants to specify a different configuration file, the alternative "Save configuration as" will help.
values.title: Save configuration

values.description:
Simple example on how to use a UI file with a plugin. UI files are in XML, [here](http://doc.qt.io/qt-5.9/designer-ui-file-format.html)'s the schema.

UI files can be generated using [Qt Designer](http://doc.qt.io/qt-5/qtdesigner-manual.html), a tool for visually building Qt objects.

One way to install Qt Designer on Ubuntu is by installing the Qt Creator IDE:

`sudo apt install qtcreator`

And then you can run Qt Designer:

`designer`
values.title: Example plugin using a Qt Designer UI file

summary.raw:
Simple example on how to use a UI file with a plugin. UI files are in XML, [here](http://doc.qt.io/qt-5.9/designer-ui-file-format.html)'s the schema.

UI files can be generated using [Qt Designer](http://doc.qt.io/qt-5/qtdesigner-manual.html), a tool for visually building Qt objects.

One way to install Qt Designer on Ubuntu is by installing the Qt Creator IDE:

`sudo apt install qtcreator`

And then you can run Qt Designer:

`designer`
summary.html:
Simple example on how to use a UI file with a plugin. UI files are in XML, here's the schema.

UI files can be generated using Qt Designer, a tool for visually building Qt objects.

One way to install Qt Designer on Ubuntu is by installing the Qt Creator IDE:

sudo apt install qtcreator

And then you can run Qt Designer:

designer

values.description:
This is the first of a series of pull requests to add functionality to automatically generate widgets from Ignition Messages.

These widgets can be used in a variety of ways, the plugin `TopicInterface` shows how they can be used to display data as it comes through an Ignition Transport topic. Other ways to use it include, for example, substituting the free-form text field in `plugins::Publisher` with widgets.

Most of the development is happening on branch `topic_interface`. On this branch, I took the core features and one widget type as a minimal working example.

The code here started as a refactor of `gazebo::gui::ConfigWidget` and keeps much of its functionality, but is more modular. Especially the tests have been kept very similar to those of `ConfigWidget_TEST` to make sure we offer the same features.

There is more documentation on each header, here's a summary:

* `plugins::TopicInterface`: the plugin holds a `MessageWidget` and provides Ignition Transport interfaces to it. For now, all it does is subscribing to a topic and updating the widget as new messages arrive. In the future, it will offer other parameters to configure things such as which widgets are visible and enabled, and also publish messages as the user inputs data.

* `MessageWidget`: a widget generated from a protobuf message. Each field in the message corresponds to a `PropertyWidget`. There will be more features coming here as well, mainly ways to configure each property.

* `PropertyWidget`: abstract base class for widgets holding properties.

* `StringWidget`: a `PropertyWidget` which holds a string value. Other property widgets can be seen on the `topic_interface` branch and will be added in future pull requests.

* `CollapsibleWidget`: A widget which can be collapsed.

# Run example

Example showing 2 widgets, one generated from a `msgs::StringMsg` and another from a `msgs::Plugin`:

`ign gui -v 4 -c examples/config/topicInterface.config`

![stringmsg.gif](data/bitbucket.org/repo/64K5zaR/images/4046020107-stringmsg.gif)

![pluginmsg.gif](data/bitbucket.org/repo/64K5zaR/images/2424589113-pluginmsg.gif)
values.title: Widgets from messages (part 1)

values.description:
Add shortcuts to the main menu options.

Note: I thought about renaming "Load configuration" to "Open configuration" to make more evident the `Ctrl+O` shortcut but I end up leaving it as it is because we're not opening a file like an editor, we're using the configuration file to load a plugin.
values.title: Shortcuts

summary.raw:
Add shortcuts to the main menu options.

Note: I thought about renaming "Load configuration" to "Open configuration" to make more evident the `Ctrl+O` shortcut but I end up leaving it as it is because we're not opening a file like an editor, we're using the configuration file to load a plugin.
summary.html:
Add shortcuts to the main menu options.

Note: I thought about renaming "Load configuration" to "Open configuration" to make more evident the Ctrl+O shortcut but I end up leaving it as it is because we're not opening a file like an editor, we're using the configuration file to load a plugin.

values.description:
- Overrides the default implementation of `closeEvent`, in order to save the configuration of the window into a file on the default config path.

FYI @clalancette

values.description:
This is an alternative to pull request #44. 

It makes the function to save the main window configuration public and adds an example on how it can be used to always save it when the window is closed. Hopefully the explanation on the README is clear.
values.title: Example of saving configuration every time window is closed

summary.raw:
This is an alternative to pull request #44. 

It makes the function to save the main window configuration public and adds an example on how it can be used to always save it when the window is closed. Hopefully the explanation on the README is clear.
summary.html:
This is an alternative to pull request #44.

It makes the function to save the main window configuration public and adds an example on how it can be used to always save it when the window is closed. Hopefully the explanation on the README is clear.

values.description:
Adds widgets for some message types which receive special treatment. For example, a pose widget is displayed as a single property instead of nested `pose -> position -> x` and so on. These messages are placed in a collapsible if they're nested into other widgets, or placed directly on the top level if that's the whole message. Examples can be tested on `topicInterface.config`:

### Top level Vector3d message with presets

![toplvlvec.gif](data/bitbucket.org/repo/64K5zaR/images/3684161561-toplvlvec.gif)

### Top level pose message

![toplvlpose.gif](data/bitbucket.org/repo/64K5zaR/images/3197814502-toplvlpose.gif)

### Nested color message with custom dialog

![nestedcolor.gif](data/bitbucket.org/repo/64K5zaR/images/2864832133-nestedcolor.gif)
values.title: Widgets from messages (part 3)
